intro: Megalastrum masafuerae, commonly known as the Masafuera starling tree, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are spherical and contain a single seed, which is dispersed by birds. Due to habitat loss, Megalastrum masafuerae is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
